title: Classic Spaghetti Carbonara
ingredients: Salt and black pepper, to taste
instructions: Cook spaghetti in salted boiling water until al dente. Reserve 1/2 cup of pasta water before draining.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, grated cheese, salt, and black pepper.
In a skillet, cook pancetta until crispy. Add minced garlic and cook for another minute.
Remove skillet from heat and add cooked spaghetti, tossing to combine with the pancetta and garlic.
Slowly pour the egg mixture over the pasta, tossing continuously to coat the pasta. Use reserved pasta water if needed to create a creamy sauce.
Serve immediately with a sprinkle of chopped parsley.

title: Baked Honey Mustard Chicken
ingredients: Salt and black pepper, to taste
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C) and grease a baking dish.
In a bowl, mix together Dijon mustard, honey, olive oil, garlic powder, dried thyme, salt, and black pepper.
Coat the chicken breasts with the honey mustard mixture and place them in the baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and no longer pink in the center.
Serve with your favorite side dishes.

title: Vegetarian Chickpea Curry
ingredients: 2 cans (15 oz each) chickpeas, drained and rinsed
Salt and chili flakes, to taste
instructions: In a large skillet, sauté the chopped onion until translucent. Add minced garlic and grated ginger, and cook for another minute.
Add the curry powder, ground cumin, ground coriander, turmeric, paprika, salt, and chili flakes. Stir well.
Pour in the diced tomatoes and coconut milk. Let the mixture simmer for about 10 minutes.
Add the drained chickpeas and let them cook in the curry for an additional 5-7 minutes.
Serve the chickpea curry over cooked rice, garnished with chopped cilantro.

title: Grilled Vegetable Panini
ingredients: Ciabatta bread or your preferred bread
Salt and black pepper, to taste
instructions: Preheat a grill or grill pan over medium-high heat.
Brush the sliced vegetables with olive oil and season with salt and black pepper.
Grill the vegetables until they are tender and have grill marks on both sides.
Slice the bread and spread pesto sauce on one side of each slice.
Layer the grilled vegetables and mozzarella slices on the pesto-covered side of the bread to form sandwiches.
Grill the sandwiches in a panini press or on a grill pan until the cheese is melted and the bread is toasted.
Serve the grilled vegetable panini warm.

title: Chocolate Banana Overnight Oats
ingredients: Chocolate chips and banana slices (for topping)
instructions: In a jar or container, combine rolled oats, milk, mashed banana, cocoa powder, chia seeds, honey or maple syrup, vanilla extract, and a pinch of salt. Mix well.
Cover the jar and refrigerate overnight, or for at least 4 hours.
Before eating, give the mixture a good stir. If it's too thick, you can add a bit more milk to achieve your desired consistency.
Top with chocolate chips and banana slices before serving.

title: Ginger Biscuits
instructions: Peel and finely grate the ginger. Wash the lemon well and rub the peel
Mix the soft margarine with the sugar. Put in the flour, baking powder, ginger and lemon peel and process it into a paste
Form balls with your hands (about 2.5 cm ∅) and put on a baking sheet with parchment paper, leaving a little distance. Press the balls flat with a fork
Set the oven to 170 °C and place them in the middle for 13 minutes, then take the ginger biscuits from the baking tray and leave them to cool

title: Grated Kohlrabi Salad
instructions: Mix well soy yogurt together with all the herbs, salt, rapeseed oil and agave syrup.
Peel and chop the shallot.
Peel kohlrabi, carrots and beetroot and grater coarsely all together with the cucumber (alternatively: chop coarsely and blend briefly).
Mix everything well and serve with the sprouts.
